capability.name: brand_name
capability.description: Brand

capability.name: model_name
capability.description: Model

capability.name: is_wireless_device
capability.description: Tells you if a device is wireless or not. Specifically a mobile phone or a PDA are considered wireless devices, a desktop PC or a laptop are not

capability.name: device_claims_web_support
capability.description: Wether the device is wireless or not, the browser may claim web support or not. Opera for Symbian is an example of a browser that claims web support (and tries to render at best) a page that was developed for web presentation independently from the device.

capability.name: proportional_font
capability.description: The standard font is proportional

capability.name: built_in_back_button_support
capability.description: User may always click on a button to go back

capability.name: card_title_support
capability.description: The device displays the title on the screen

capability.name: softkey_support
capability.description: Softkeys are supported

capability.name: table_support
capability.description: The browser displays tables formatted "correctly" (rather than 1 cell per line)

capability.name: numbered_menus
capability.description: The browser lists numbers to pick an element from a list

capability.name: menu_with_select_element_recommended
capability.description: A select element is the most usable menu format

capability.name: menu_with_list_of_links_recommended
capability.description: A list of links is the most usable menu format

capability.name: icons_on_menu_items_support
capability.description: Links may be associated with icons

capability.name: break_list_of_links_with_br_element_recommended
capability.description:
When presenting a list of links the use of
is suggested for better presentation

capability.name: access_key_support
capability.description: respects the "accesskey" attribute of the anchor tag

capability.name: wrap_mode_support
capability.description: The browser can be forced to wrap or not lines

capability.name: times_square_mode_support
capability.description:
"time_square_mode_support" is an Openwave browser specific feature related to what happens with code that looks like

. The Openwave browser will present the text in this block on a single line that will only scroll (like marquee) when the line has been activated (has focus). Other browser either cropped such blocks, or force ths user to scroll horizontally on the page.

capability.name: deck_prefetch_support
capability.description: Prefetching of other decks is supported

capability.name: elective_forms_recommended
capability.description: input and select elements can/should be placed in a single card rather than on discrete cards

capability.name: wizards_recommended
capability.description: wizards_recommended

capability.name: image_as_link_support
capability.description: You may use images to present a link

capability.name: insert_br_element_after_widget_recommended
capability.description: The use of a break is suggested after widgets

capability.name: wml_can_display_images_and_text_on_same_line
capability.description: Some devices not display an image and text on the same line. Set this to true if the device supports it

capability.name: wml_displays_image_in_center
capability.description: Some devices will show images aligned in center by default, true if this happens

capability.name: opwv_wml_extensions_support
capability.description: This is specific for Openwave browsers and possibly third party browsers that are compatible. As WML extensions we mean pictograms and other tags that were never formalized by the WAP forum

capability.name: wml_make_phone_call_string
capability.description: Prefix to initiate a voice call

capability.name: chtml_display_accesskey
capability.description: The device displays a number when you use an accesskey

capability.name: emoji
capability.description: Emoji are special characters which appear in i-Mode pages as small icons

capability.name: chtml_can_display_images_and_text_on_same_line
capability.description: As for WML, this is set to true if the device can display images and text on the same line

capability.name: chtml_displays_image_in_center
capability.description: As for WML, this is set to true if the device will align images in center by default

capability.name: imode_region
capability.description: This field describes the market region for the device, useful for emoji's and other possible localizations. Possible values as "ja" for Japan, "eu" for Europe, "us" for USA "as" for Asia. "none" means unknown or not set.

capability.name: chtml_make_phone_call_string
capability.description: Prefix to initiate a voice call

capability.name: chtml_table_support
capability.description: Tables are not supported by default on i-mode/chtml devices. This capability tells you if the device supports this "extra" feature

capability.name: xhtml_honors_bgcolor
capability.description: Background colour can be set

capability.name: xhtml_supports_forms_in_table
capability.description: Form entry within a table is possible

capability.name: xhtml_support_wml2_namespace
capability.description: The WML version 2.0 namespace is supported, so the device will successfully render WML2.0 content

capability.name: xhtml_autoexpand_select
capability.description: Some device automatically expand select's (MOT T720, for example)

capability.name: xhtml_select_as_dropdown
capability.description: The device displays select's as dropdown lists

capability.name: xhtml_select_as_radiobutton
capability.description: The device displays select's as radio buttons

capability.name: xhtml_select_as_popup
capability.description: The device displays select's as popup lists, similar to the Openwave GUI extension

capability.name: xhtml_display_accesskey
capability.description: The device displays a number when you use an accesskey

capability.name: xhtml_supports_inline_input
capability.description: Some browsers let you type text locally. Others bring you to a separate data entry control.

capability.name: xhtml_supports_monospace_font
capability.description: Does device support monospace fonts only?

capability.name: xhtml_supports_table_for_layout
capability.description: This device support for tables is solid enough that you can use tables to layout content on the screen.Used in WALL)

capability.name: xhtml_supports_css_cell_table_coloring
capability.description: CSS support in this device is good enough that table cells are correctly colored when the color is defined through CSS (Used in WALL)

capability.name: xhtml_format_as_css_property
capability.description: This field is true if the device supports a css property to define the format of an input field. This is what the "format" attribute was in WML. Follows the same rules as "format" used to do. Example: style= "-wap-input-format:NNNN" (Used in WALL)

capability.name: xhtml_format_as_attribute
capability.description: This is set true if the device supports the "format" attribute in input fields (Used in WALL)

capability.name: xhtml_nowrap_mode
capability.description: Does device support wrap mode as a XHTML attribute? (Used by WALL)

capability.name: xhtml_marquee_as_css_property
capability.description: Does device support MARQUEE though CSS syntax? (used by WALL)

capability.name: xhtml_readable_background_color1
capability.description: This and the following properties lets you define 2 colors which interoperate visually on the device. For example, by using one of these two colors as background, you don't risk that an hyperlink disappears against its background. (Used by WALL) against

capability.name: xhtml_readable_background_color2
capability.description: refer to xhtml_readable_background_ color1 for description (Used by WALL)

capability.name: xhtml_allows_disabled_form_elements
capability.description: XHTML lets you define "disabled" form elements. If this actually works on the different devices is tracked down by this capability.

capability.name: xhtml_document_title_support
capability.description: While one can define the document title with the title tag, not all devices actually render the title. This capability keeps track of that behavior (Used by WALL)

capability.name: xhtml_preferred_charset
capability.description: UTF-8 should be supported by default, but some devices have problems. Here you may find alternative charsets such as iso8859. This field does not present the exact charset because with ISO charsets you may need to specify the one of your region (1, 15, other) - Capability mentor: Pau Aliagas

capability.name: opwv_xhtml_extensions_support
capability.description: The Openwave browser has some supports some useful extensions. Tracked by this capability (used by WALL)

capability.name: xhtml_make_phone_call_string
capability.description: Prefix to initiate a voice call (Used by WALL)

capability.name: xhtmlmp_preferred_mime_type
capability.description: Most devices should support both text/html and the specific XHTML MP mime type. Some are a little pickie, here you should find a mime type that always works. Default is text/html

capability.name: xhtml_table_support
capability.description: tables SHOULD be supported as syntax, but are often rendered poorly. This tag tells you if the browser is able to render tables decently

capability.name: preferred_markup
capability.description: This field identifies which markup is best supported by the device. This field is filled on personal experiences of our contributors and is used by the WALL library. Values for this capability look like: wml_1_1, html_wi_imode_compact_ generic and html_wi_oma_xhtmlmp_1_0. Just like any other capability, you may override this value in the patch file

capability.name: wml_1_1
capability.description: Supports WML version 1.1

capability.name: wml_1_2
capability.description: Supports WML version 1.2

capability.name: wml_1_3
capability.description: Supports WML version 1.3

capability.name: wmlscript_1_0
capability.description: Supports WML script version 1.0

capability.name: wmlscript_1_1
capability.description: Supports WML script version 1.1

capability.name: wmlscript_1_2
capability.description: Supports WML script version 1.2

capability.name: wmlscript_1_3
capability.description: Supports WML script version 1.3

capability.name: html_wi_w3_xhtmlbasic
capability.description: XHTML basic is XHTML reduced to a minimal set of tags, and was introduced to serve as a basis for a markup which would work on devices with very limited capabilities.

capability.name: html_wi_oma_xhtmlmp_1_0
capability.description: XHTML MP is XHTML Basic with the addition of a few extra tags to allow for the application of WCSS ('style' attribute and tag, 'hr' tag)

capability.name: html_wi_imode_html_1
capability.description: Supports DoCoMo's iHTML version 1.0

capability.name: html_wi_imode_html_2
capability.description: Supports DoCoMo's iHTML version 2.0

capability.name: html_wi_imode_html_3
capability.description: Supports DoCoMo's iHTML version 3.0

capability.name: html_wi_imode_html_4
capability.description: Supports DoCoMo's iHTML version 4.0

capability.name: html_wi_imode_html_5
capability.description: Supports DoCoMo's iHTML version 5.0

capability.name: html_wi_imode_htmlx_1
capability.description: Supports DoCoMo's xHTML version 1.0

capability.name: html_wi_imode_htmlx_1_1
capability.description: Supports DoCoMo's xHTML version 1.1

capability.name: html_wi_imode_compact_generic
capability.description: Supports generic compact HTML (cHTML)

capability.name: html_web_3_2
capability.description: Supports HTML version 3.2

capability.name: html_web_4_0
capability.description: Supports HTML version 4

capability.name: voicexml
capability.description: Supports voice XML

capability.name: multipart_support
capability.description: Supports multipart contents

capability.name: total_cache_disable_support
capability.description: possibility to disable the browser's cache completely

capability.name: time_to_live_support
capability.description: Device support 'time to live'(TLL) or not. The length of time that a device keeps a deck in cache is called the time to live (TTL). The default TTL is 30 days (or until memory is exhausted) for Openwave browsers. If a deck contains time-sensitive information, you can specify a shorter TTL so that the device will reload the deck from the server more frequently.

capability.name: resolution_width
capability.description: This field represents the display's usable width

capability.name: resolution_height
capability.description: This field represents the display's usable height

capability.name: columns
capability.description: Number of columns presented

capability.name: rows
capability.description: Number of lines presented

capability.name: max_image_width
capability.description: Width of the images viewable

capability.name: max_image_height
capability.description: Height of the images viewable

capability.name: wbmp
capability.description: supports wbmp format

capability.name: bmp
capability.description: Supports bmp format

capability.name: epoc_bmp
capability.description: Supports the EPOC (Symbian) bitmap format, also known as mbm

capability.name: gif
capability.description: supports gif format

capability.name: gif_animated
capability.description: supports animated gif (gif89a) format

capability.name: jpg
capability.description: supports jpg format

capability.name: png
capability.description: supports png format

capability.name: tiff
capability.description: supports tif format

capability.name: flash_lite
capability.description: supports flash lite format version 1.0

capability.name: flash_lite_1_1
capability.description: supports flash lite format version 1.1

capability.name: flash_lite_download_limit
capability.description: Defines the download limit in bytes for flash lite files

capability.name: svgt_1_1
capability.description: supports SVGT v1.1 - Capability mentor: Antoine Quint

capability.name: svgt_1_1_plus
capability.description: supports SVGT v1.1+ - Capability mentor: Antoine Quint

capability.name: greyscale
capability.description: supports greyscale format

capability.name: colors
capability.description: In general the number of colors used by the phone

capability.name: post_method_support
capability.description: If true the phone supports HTTP POST method

capability.name: basic_authentication_support
capability.description: basic authentication support (login and password)

capability.name: emptyok
capability.description: An empty select is allowed

capability.name: empty_option_value_support
capability.description: If true the phone will allow the user to pick an empty value from a select

capability.name: nokia_voice_call
capability.description: Supports the Nokia 'make call' function

capability.name: wta_voice_call
capability.description: Supports the standard WML call function

capability.name: wta_phonebook
capability.description: The WTA implementation supports access to the device's phonebook

capability.name: wta_misc
capability.description: The WTA implementation supports the miscellaneous features of the WTAI specification

capability.name: wta_pdc
capability.description: Supports WTA over a PDC network

capability.name: https_support
capability.description: support for HTTPS protocol (SSL connections)

capability.name: https_detectable
capability.description: The device can detect when a request is made to an HTTPS resource

capability.name: phone_id_provided
capability.description: The IMEI number is accessible

capability.name: max_deck_size
capability.description: Maximum allowed size for a deck in bytes

capability.name: max_url_length_in_requests
capability.description: Maximum allowed URL length

capability.name: max_url_length_homepage
capability.description: Maximum allowed URL length for the browser's homepage

capability.name: max_url_length_bookmark
capability.description: Maximum allowed URL length for a bookmark

capability.name: max_url_length_cached_page
capability.description: Maximum allowed URL length for a cached page

capability.name: max_no_of_connection_settings
capability.description: Number of connection profiles supported

capability.name: max_no_of_bookmarks
capability.description: Number of bookmarks the browser can store

capability.name: max_length_of_username
capability.description: Maximum allowed length for a username

capability.name: max_length_of_password
capability.description: Maximum allowed length for a password

capability.name: max_object_size
capability.description: The maximum filesize supported when downloading using WTP-SAR

capability.name: downloadfun_support
capability.description: if true the phone supports downloadfun features

capability.name: directdownload_support
capability.description: if true the phone supports object downloading in an anchor

capability.name: inline_support
capability.description: if true the phone has the possibility to save an image or object shown in a page

capability.name: oma_support
capability.description: if true the phone supports OMA specifications for object downloading

capability.name: ringtone
capability.description: if true the phone supports the download of ringtones

capability.name: ringtone_midi_monophonic
capability.description: support for monophonic (type 0) midi files

capability.name: ringtone_midi_polyphonic
capability.description: support for polyphonic midi files

capability.name: ringtone_imelody
capability.description: support for the download of iMelody files

capability.name: ringtone_digiplug
capability.description: support for the download of digiplug files

capability.name: ringtone_compactmidi
capability.description: support for the download of compact-midi files

capability.name: ringtone_mmf
capability.description: support for the download of MMF/SMAF files (Yamaha)

capability.name: ringtone_rmf
capability.description: support for the download of RMF files (Beatnik)

capability.name: ringtone_xmf
capability.description: support for the download of XMF files (Beatink - midi approved)

capability.name: ringtone_amr
capability.description: support for the download of AMR files

capability.name: ringtone_awb
capability.description: support for the download of AMR wide band files

capability.name: ringtone_aac
capability.description: support for the download of AAC files

capability.name: ringtone_wav
capability.description: support for the download of WAV files

capability.name: ringtone_mp3
capability.description: support for the download of MP3 files

capability.name: ringtone_spmidi
capability.description: support for the download of SPmidi files

capability.name: ringtone_qcelp
capability.description: support for the download of qcelp (Qualcomm format) files

capability.name: ringtone_voices
capability.description: Represents the maximum number of voices for a downloaded ringtone

capability.name: ringtone_df_size_limit
capability.description: Size limit in bytes of downloadable ringtones through downloadfun

capability.name: ringtone_directdownload_size_limit
capability.description: Size limit in bytes of downloadable ringtones through direct download

capability.name: ringtone_inline_size_limit
capability.description: Size limit in bytes of downloadable ringtones for inline objects

capability.name: ringtone_oma_size_limit
capability.description: Size limit in bytes of downloadable ringtones through OMA DD

capability.name: wallpaper
capability.description: if true the phone supports the download of wallpapers

capability.name: wallpaper_wbmp
capability.description: support for wbmp images

capability.name: wallpaper_bmp
capability.description: support for bmp images

capability.name: wallpaper_gif
capability.description: support for gif images

capability.name: wallpaper_jpg
capability.description: support for jpg images

capability.name: wallpaper_png
capability.description: support for png images

capability.name: wallpaper_tiff
capability.description: support for tiff images

capability.name: wallpaper_greyscale
capability.description: true if the phone users a greyscale

capability.name: wallpaper_colors
capability.description: This is the number in bit of displayable colors. Note: if a phone uses 8 tones of grey, you should set wallpaper_greyscale to true and wallpaper_colors to 3

capability.name: wallpaper_max_width
capability.description: Maximum width supported for a wallpaper

capability.name: wallpaper_max_height
capability.description: Maximum height supported for a wallpaper

capability.name: wallpaper_preferred_width
capability.description: Maximum width suggested for a wallpaper

capability.name: wallpaper_preferred_height
capability.description: Maximum height suggested for a wallpaper

capability.name: wallpaper_df_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a wallpaper

capability.name: wallpaper_directdownload_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a wallpaper

capability.name: wallpaper_inline_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a wallpaper

capability.name: wallpaper_oma_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a wallpaper

capability.name: wallpaper_resize
capability.description: Describes if and how the device resizes a downloaded wallpaper if not exactly the same size of the screen. Possible values are "none", "fixed_ratio" (rescale respecting original proportions), "crop_centered", "crop_top_left".

capability.name: screensaver
capability.description: if true the phone supports the download of screensavers

capability.name: screensaver_wbmp
capability.description: support for wbmp images

capability.name: screensaver_bmp
capability.description: support for bmp images

capability.name: screensaver_gif
capability.description: support for gif images

capability.name: screensaver_jpg
capability.description: support for jpg images

capability.name: screensaver_png
capability.description: support for png images

capability.name: screensaver_greyscale
capability.description: true if the phone users a greyscale

capability.name: screensaver_colors
capability.description: This is the number in bit of displayable colors. Note: if a phone uses 8 tones of grey, you should set wallpaper_greyscale to true and wallpaper_colors to 3

capability.name: screensaver_max_width
capability.description: Maximum width supported for a screensaver

capability.name: screensaver_max_height
capability.description: Maximum height supported for a screensaver

capability.name: screensaver_preferred_width
capability.description: Maximum width suggested for a screensaver

capability.name: screensaver_preferred_height
capability.description: Maximum height suggested for a screensaver

capability.name: screensaver_df_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a screensaver through downloadfun

capability.name: screensaver_directdownload_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a screensave through direct download

capability.name: screensaver_inline_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a screensaver for an inline object

capability.name: screensaver_oma_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a screensaver through OMA DD

capability.name: screensaver_resize
capability.description: Describes if and how the device resizes a downloaded screensaver if not exactly the same size of the screen. Possible values are "none", "fixed_ratio" (rescale respecting original proportions), "crop_centered", "crop_top_left".

capability.name: picture
capability.description: if true the phone supports the download of picture files

capability.name: picture_wbmp
capability.description: support for wbmp images

capability.name: picture_bmp
capability.description: support for bmp images

capability.name: picture_gif
capability.description: support for gif images

capability.name: picture_jpg
capability.description: support for jpg images

capability.name: picture_png
capability.description: support for png images

capability.name: picture_greyscale
capability.description: true if the phone users a greyscale

capability.name: picture_colors
capability.description: This is the number in bit of displayable colors. Note: if a phone uses 8 tones of grey, you should set wallpaper_greyscale to true and wallpaper_colors to 3

capability.name: picture_max_width
capability.description: Maximum width supported for a picture

capability.name: picture_max_height
capability.description: Maximum height supported for a picture

capability.name: picture_preferred_width
capability.description: Maximum width suggested for a picture

capability.name: picture_preferred_height
capability.description: Maximum height suggested for a picture

capability.name: picture_df_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a picture throught downloadfun

capability.name: picture_directdownload_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a picture throught direct download

capability.name: picture_inline_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a picture for an inline object

capability.name: picture_oma_size_limit
capability.description: Maximum size in bytes of a picture through OMA DD

capability.name: picture_resize
capability.description: Describes if and how the device resizes a downloaded picture if not exactly the same size of the screen. Possible values are "none", "fixed_ratio" (rescale respecting original proportions), "crop_centered", "crop_top_left".

capability.name: video
capability.description: true if the phone may download video clips

capability.name: video_real_media_8
capability.description: true if the phone supports real media V8

capability.name: video_real_media_9
capability.description: true if the phone supports real media V9

capability.name: video_real_media_10
capability.description: true if the phone supports real media V10

capability.name: video_3gpp
capability.description: true if the phone supports 3GPP videos (including H.263)

capability.name: video_3gpp2
capability.description: true if the phone supports 3GPP 2 videos (for CDMA devices)

capability.name: video_mp4
capability.description: true if the phone supports MP4 videos

capability.name: video_wmv
capability.description: true if the phone supports WMV videos

capability.name: video_mov
capability.description: true if the phone supports MOV videos

capability.name: video_max_frame_rate
capability.description: Max frame rate supported. 0 is the default

capability.name: video_max_width
capability.description: Max width. 0 is the default

capability.name: video_max_height
capability.description: Max height. 0 is the default

capability.name: video_qcif
capability.description: True if the device can play QCIF videos

capability.name: video_sqcif
capability.description: True if the device can play SQCIF videos

capability.name: video_preferred_width
capability.description: Suggested max height so that the device will not need any resizing. 0 is the default

capability.name: video_preferred_height
capability.description: Suggested max height so that the device will not need any resizing. 0 is the default

capability.name: video_df_size_limit
capability.description: Max size in bytes for downloadfun. 0 is the default

capability.name: video_directdownload_size_limit
capability.description: Max size in bytes for directdownload. 0 is the default

capability.name: video_inline_size_limit
capability.description: Max size in bytes for inline download. 0 is the default

capability.name: video_oma_size_limit
capability.description: Max size in bytes for OMA DD. 0 is the default

capability.name: video_vcodec_h263_0
capability.description: True if the device can play videos encoded using H.263 type 0

capability.name: video_vcodec_h263_3
capability.description: True if the device can play videos encoded using H.263 type 3

capability.name: video_vcodec_mpeg4
capability.description: True if the device can play videos encoded using MPEG 4

capability.name: video_acodec_amr
capability.description: True if the device can play videos with AMR audio

capability.name: video_acodec_awb
capability.description: True if the device can play videos with AMR Wide-Band audio

capability.name: video_acodec_aac
capability.description: True if the device can play videos with AAC audio

capability.name: video_acodec_aac_ltp
capability.description: True if the device can play videos with AAC LTP audio

capability.name: video_acodec_qcelp
capability.description: True if the device can play videos with Qualcomm Code Excited Linear Predictive waveform audio format

capability.name: oma_v_1_0_forwardlock
capability.description: true if the phone support OMA DRM ForwardLock V1.0

capability.name: oma_v_1_0_combined_delivery
capability.description: true if the phone support OMA DRM Combined Delivery V1.0

capability.name: oma_v_1_0_separate_delivery
capability.description: true if the phone support OMA DRM Separate Delivery V1.0

capability.name: streaming_video
capability.description: true if the phone supports video streaming

capability.name: streaming_real_media_8
capability.description: true if the phone supports Real media V8

capability.name: streaming_real_media_9
capability.description: true if the phone supports Real media V9

capability.name: streaming_real_media_10
capability.description: true if the phone supports Real media V10

capability.name: streaming_3gpp

capability.name: j2me_left_softkey_code
capability.description: The number refers to the value which is returned by an event handler method in the j2me APIs, so its an internal number (which is implementation dependant). When the left softkey is pressed, this will be the value returned by the even handler (often a negative number).

capability.name: j2me_right_softkey_code
capability.description: The number refers to the value which is returned by an event handler method in the j2me APIs, so its an internal number (which is implementation dependant). When the right softkey is pressed, this will be the value returned by the even handler (often a negative number).

capability.name: j2me_middle_softkey_code
capability.description: The number refers to the value which is returned by an event handler method in the j2me APIs, so its an internal number (which is implementation dependant). When the middle softkey is pressed, this will be the value returned by the even handler (often a negative number).

capability.name: j2me_select_key_code
capability.description: The number refers to the value which is returned by an event handler method in the j2me APIs, so its an internal number (which is implementation dependant). When the 'select' softkey is pressed, this will be the value returned by the even handler (often a negative number).

capability.name: j2me_return_key_code
capability.description: The number refers to the value which is returned by an event handler method in the j2me APIs, so its an internal number (which is implementation dependant). When the 'return' softkey is pressed, this will be the value returned by the even handler (often a negative number).

capability.name: j2me_clear_key_code
capability.description: The number refers to the value which is returned by an event handler method in the j2me APIs, so its an internal number (which is implementation dependant). When the 'clear' key is pressed, this will be the value returned by the even handler (often a negative number).

capability.name: j2me_datefield_no_accepts_null_date
capability.description: datefields do not accept empty values (this is a bug)

capability.name: j2me_datefield_broken
capability.description: datefields do not work (this is a bug)

capability.name: wav
capability.description: Supports the .wav (Waveform) sound format

capability.name: mmf
capability.description: Supports the MMF (a Yamaha format) version is understood by the number of voices

capability.name: smf
capability.description: Supports the smf (Standard MIDI File) sound format

capability.name: mld
capability.description: An iMode sound format

capability.name: midi_monophonic
capability.description: Supports the midi (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) monophonic sound format

capability.name: midi_polyphonic
capability.description: Supports the midi (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) polyphonic sound format

capability.name: sp_midi
capability.description: Supports the Scalable Polyphony MIDI sound format

capability.name: rmf
capability.description: Supports the rmf sound format (Beatnik format)

capability.name: xmf
capability.description: Supports the XMF sound format (Beatnik format)

capability.name: compactmidi
capability.description: Supports the Compact MIDI sound format (a Faith Inc. format)

capability.name: digiplug
capability.description: A compact polyphonic sound format developed by the Digiplug company

capability.name: nokia_ringtone
capability.description: Supports the Nokia ringing tone sound format

capability.name: imelody
capability.description: A standard file format for melodies, also adopted as the ringtone format by the 4 companies developing the EMS standard

capability.name: au
capability.description: Also called the uLaw, NeXT, or Sun Audio format

capability.name: amr
capability.description: AMR standard sound format

capability.name: awb
capability.description: AMR wide band standard sound format

capability.name: aac
capability.description: AAC standard sound format

capability.name: mp3
capability.description: Supports the mp3 sound format

capability.name: qcelp
capability.description: Supports the Qualcomm Code Excited Linear Predictive waveform format

capability.name: evrc
capability.description: Supports the Enhanced Variable Rate Codec waveform format

capability.name: voices
capability.description: Maximum number of notes the device can play at the same time
